azurerm_monitor_diagnostic_setting.description: Manages a Diagnostic Setting for an existing Resource.

name.description: Specifies the name of the Diagnostic Setting. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

target_resource_id.description: The ID of an existing Resource on which to configure Diagnostic Settings. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

eventhub_name.description: Specifies the name of the Event Hub where Diagnostics Data should be sent. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
eventhub_name.notes: If this isn't specified then the default Event Hub will be used.

eventhub_authorization_rule_id.description: Specifies the ID of an Event Hub Namespace Authorization Rule used to send Diagnostics Data. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
eventhub_authorization_rule_id.notes: One of `eventhub_authorization_rule_id`, `log_analytics_workspace_id` and `storage_account_id` must be specified.

log.description: One or more `log` blocks as defined below.
log.notes: At least one `log` or `metric` block must be specified.

log_analytics_workspace_id.description: Specifies the ID of a Log Analytics Workspace where Diagnostics Data should be sent. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
log_analytics_workspace_id.notes: One of `eventhub_authorization_rule_id`, `log_analytics_workspace_id` and `storage_account_id` must be specified.

metric.description: One or more `metric` blocks as defined below.
metric.notes: At least one `log` or `metric` block must be specified.

storage_account_id.description: With this parameter you can specify a storage account which should be used to send the logs to. Parameter must be a valid Azure Resource ID. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
storage_account_id.notes: One of `eventhub_authorization_rule_id`, `log_analytics_workspace_id` and `storage_account_id` must be specified.

log_analytics_destination_type.description: When set to 'Dedicated' logs sent to a Log Analytics workspace will go into resource specific tables, instead of the legacy AzureDiagnostics table.
log_analytics_destination_type.notes: This setting will only have an effect if a `log_analytics_workspace_id` is provided, and the resource is available for resource-specific logs.  As of July 2019, this only includes Azure Data Factory. Please [see the documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/platform/diagnostic-logs-stream-log-store#azure-diagnostics-vs-resource-specific) for more information.

category.description: The name of a Diagnostic Metric Category for this Resource.
category.notes: The Metric Categories available vary depending on the Resource being used. You may wish to use [the `azurerm_monitor_diagnostic_categories` Data Source](../d/monitor_diagnostic_categories.html) to identify which categories are available for a given Resource.

days.description: The number of days for which this Retention Policy should apply.
days.notes: Setting this to `0` will retain the events indefinitely.

id.description: The ID of the Diagnostic Setting.

create.description: Used when creating the Diagnostics Setting.

update.description: Used when updating the Diagnostics Setting.

read.description: Used when retrieving the Diagnostics Setting.

delete.description: Used when deleting the Diagnostics Setting.
